nodes.bodyText: Can you check the latest vpc_manager codes? We have updated its pom.file to exclude a generated jar file in the dependencies list?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,128 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

+	<groupId>com.futurewei.alcor.macmanager</groupId>

@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+HELP.md
+target/

nodes.bodyText:
This deserves a API, instead of "debug2" :-)
How about /macs/activeranges or similar?
I removed them.

For MacAddressService, I would suggest to split into two layers, service layer and service impl layer.
Service Layer: Show the interface
Service Impl Layer: Show the implementation of the interface. This design allows different implementations later on.
One example of the above design is SubnetManager:
https://github.com/kevin-zhonghao/alcor/tree/feature/route_manager/services/subnet_manager/src/main/java/com/futurewei/alcor/subnet/service
Actually, this is a great idea. I will do it.
Do you mean "MAC_ADDRESS_LENGTH“?

+@Data

+
+    public static final String MAC_DELIMITER = "-";
+    public static final int NIC_LENGTH = 24;

nodes.bodyText: No, MAC_ADDRESS_LENGTH is fixed as 48 ( OUI: 24, NIC: 24) NIC_LENGTH is the bytes we use to generate mac address because OUI is fixed. By default, this is 24, but it can be 12, 6, etc in future if needed.

nodes.bodyText: Do we need to verify the post return?

Yes, this returns a created mac address, which is necessary information to test other APIs such as delete or get. Usually return is not needed, but in mac manager, we don't know Mac address until it is created.
